abstract: Todd Combs, until now a little-known hedge fund manager, rises to prominence and figures in succession talks at Berkshire Hathaway.
snippet: Todd Combs, until now a little-known hedge fund manager, rises to prominence and figures in succession talks at Berkshire Hathaway.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett announced Monday that his company, Berkshire Hathaway, had hired a young hedge fund manager to oversee a “significant portion” of its investment portfolio, adding a new name to the mix of players who are someday expected to take the reins at Berkshire.

headline.main: Buffett Hires an Outsider to Oversee Investments
headline.print_headline: Buffett Hires an Outsider To Oversee Investments

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Thomas Kaplan

abstract: The billionaire said that Todd Combs, the 39-year-old hired to run a portion of Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio, is a top candidate to be the company’s next investment chief.
snippet: The billionaire said that Todd Combs, the 39-year-old hired to run a portion of Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio, is a top candidate to be the company’s next investment chief.
lead_paragraph: Few topics grab investors’ attention than the question of who might succeed Warren E. Buffett as the maestro of Berkshire Hathaway. But on Monday, the Oracle of Omaha himself weighed in on the matter.

headline.main: Buffett Opens Up on Succession Planning
